result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred judgment agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed. The defendant has not been convicted of the dismissed charges.

The defendant Carl A. Hawks Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Follow all conditions of DEJ agreement on count 3

miscConds.notes: The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

supervisions.notes:
Follow all conditions of DEJ agreement.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carl A. Hawks Jr.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Carl A. Hawks in court without counsel.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called 9:10 AM. State - Part of a DEJ to pay restitution over a period of time, DEJ was extended a couple of times. Hawks indicates restitution was paid in full yesterday. Clerk confirms. State asks to release restitution to victim and proceed with agreement, dimissing count. Court so orders.
Hearing on September 28, 2018 at 09:30 am.
Income Assignment Order for Unpaid Fines and Other Financial Obligations - copies sent to appropriate parties.
CH

Defendant Carl A. Hawks in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:30 AM. Court - here for non-payment of restitution on a deferred entry of judgment. State agrees, defendant has made few payments in the last year. Clerk provides Court with a breakdown of payments made and balance still owed and amount originally ordered. Court asks the defendant why he hasn't paid recently. Defendant responds, makes statement in regards to just filed taxes and can put his refund towards the restitution. Court goes thru financial collaquey with the defendant. Off record to discuss wage garnishment. Back on record at 9:45 AM. Clerk will contact the employer to make arrangements for the payment to be taken out of his paycheck at the rate of $100.00/week or $400.00/month. Defendant is willing to participate in the voluntary wage assignment. Hawks agrees to extend the DEJ until the restitution is paid in full. Clerk/State to monitor the payments and will get the matter back on the calendar if needed. Court extends the DEJ until restitution is paid in full, gives defendant a talk on how he is/should be spending his money. If Clerk is not able to get a wage assignment from the employer, contact the Court and we will set it for another hearing. Adjourned at 9:48 AM.
In support of motion revoking the defendant's deferred entry of judgment
to revoke defendant's deferred entry of judgment and to proceed to sentencing.

Defendant Carl A. Hawks not in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:56 AM. State - here for review on DPA/DEJ. Clerk informs the Court that notice was sent to defendant. Off record to review file by Court. Back on record at 10:58 AM. Court finds notice was sent to defendant. State updates the Court on the amount of restitution paid by the defendant at this time and what is still owed. Court asks if the defendant is on probation or DEJ. State replies. Court informs State to make a motion to rescind. State replies, did that once and Court allowed an extension for a year. State would like the Court to schedule this matter for a motion to revoke. Court instructs State to file the motion and serve the defendant with it. State to contact JA Belliveau for a motion date.
Review hearing on January 17, 2018 at 10:45 am.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Carl A. Hawks in court with attorney Paul Arbuckle.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:07 AM. State willing to extend Deferred Prosecution Agreement for 12 months per off-record discussions. Arbuckle and Hawks agree to an extension. Court asks questions of the defendant and his ability to pay the restitution. State informs Court who the victims in the case are. Court wants the Clerk of Court's Office to collect the money for the restitution. Defendant has been paying about $175.00/week. Arbuckle believes that is a little extensive as it is half of his paycheck. State suggests the defendant possibly take out a loan. Court orders $125.00/week to be paid by the defendant towards the restitution, also suggests remitting his tax returns if any, Court extends the deferred procecution agreement for one year, Clerk to set for review approximately one month prior to it ending. Adjourned at 9:12 AM.
Motion hearing on October 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Motion hearing on June 30, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Quashed per Judge O'Melia
Body only

Defendant Carl A. Hawks not in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:18 AM. State updates Court on the case and has confirmed that the defendant has not been making payments towards his restitution. Court issues bench warrant, body only.
Hearing on May 26, 2016 at 11:00 am.
if a tax return is obtained by the defendant, he is ordered to hold it or provide it to the Clerk of Court's Office until further order of the Court.

Defendant Carl A. Hawks in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:53 PM. Judge O'Melia appears via phone from Oneida County. Court has motion to rescind the DEJ due to non-payment of restitituion that was to be paid in DEJ. State agrees, no payments have been made since the entry of the agreement. Hawks agrees that he has not made any payments but stated that he thought that when he paid his probation officer that it would be going towards this. State provides the defendant with a copy of the DEJ and instructs him that the DEJ was outside of the probation. Defendant reviews DEJ. State - $7611.68 was total restitution was ordered thru the DEJ. Court reviews DEJ. Defendant states he is still on probation. State - would be a felony probation case. State willing to set for another hearing to allow the defendant to check on where the money went that he paid to P&P. Court modifies bond - add a condition that if a tax return is obtained by the defendant, he is ordered to hold it or provide it to the Clerk of Court's Office until further order of the Court. Defendant agrees. Court sets for another hearing and State to get the accouting information from the P&P agent. State - need to set a monetary value on a bond. Court- $2500.00 signature bond with the conditon as previously mentioned.  Hearing scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Hearing on May 11, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
State's in support of revoking DEJ and proceed to sentencing
to revoke DEJ and proceed to sentencing
Corrected

undecided
DEJ agreement

Defendant Carl A. Hawks in court/custody with attorney Mary L Burns.  Jodie L Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 9:54 am. Resolved state recites joint recommendation - amend count 1 to misdemeanor theft - w/hold and probation 2 years - count 2 amend to issuance worthless check misdemeanor - w/hold 2 years probation - AODA and follow thru - all other conditions as indicated in deferred judgment - sobriety - no poss/consume of alcohol/drugs and take all med's as prescribed - count 3 - 2 year deferred entry - costs on counts 1 & 2. Court amends count 1 & 2 as recited by state. Defendant pleads G as amended to all counts. Court goes thru plea questionnaire and finds that defendant is entering his plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently by entering his plea and waiving right to JT, factual basis, accepts pleas, adjudges guility and will proceed to sentencing. State has complied with victim notification. No victim impact in the file. Court corrects maximum penalties on counts.  Bednar makes statement follow joint recommendation. Burns follow joint recommendation. Hawks withholds statement. Court sentences to following:

Ct 1 - w/hold sentence and place on probation for 2 years - costs and - AODA and follow thru - follow all other conditions as indicated in count 3 deferred entry judgment.

Ct 2 - w/hold sentence and place on probation for 2 years concurrent to count 1 - costs and conditions as indicated in count 1.

Ct 3 accept deferred entry. 

115 days credit if revoked.

DNA surchage on 1 count $200

Appeal rights given.
State's
Final pre-trial on June 13, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Called at 10:35 AM. Carl Hawks Jr appears via video from FOSO and his attorney Mary Burns appears in person. State appears by Charles Simono. Judge O'Melia appears via telephone from Oneida County - does not have the Information. State - it mirrors the complaint. Burns has Information, waives reading of it, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas. Court asks for update on defendants incarceration. Burns reponds. Court continues bond, set for FPT on 6/13/14 at 10:00 AM. Burns will address bond later if the defendant can get into treatment. Court will take a look at then if/when it happens.
Arraignment on April 29, 2014 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Emailed JA information

Called at 3:34 PM. Carl Hawks Jr appears in person and in custody with attorney Mary Burns. State appears by Charles Simono. Court has waiver of PH and State has filed Information that mirrors the complaint in anticipation of the waiver. Court goes thru waiver, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Burns has Information and files request for substitution. Court accepts request as timely, other matters will be set when new Judge is assigned, court continues bond.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: No consumption of alcohol and to take all prescriptions as prescribed and in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Preliminary hearing on March 19, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Called at 1:28 PM. Carl Hawks Jr appears via video from FOSO and his attorney Mary Burns appears in person. State appears by Charles Simono. Burns just received the complaint and has not had a chance to go over it with the defendant. Court reads charges and penalties. Burns requests PH, may be a waiver of it. State asks for two conditions to be added to bond: no consumption of alcohol and to take all prescriptions as prescribed and in the manner in which they are prescribed. Burns has no objections to those conditions and asks for a signature to get him into treatment. State would have no objections to that once proof of a bed is secured. Burns willing to waive time limits for PH until 3/26 but she is not available that day. Court sets for PH on 3/19/14 at 3:00 PM and add conditions as stated by State to the bond.
defendant
Adjourned initial appearance on March 12, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Called at 10:41 AM. Carl Hawks Jr appears via video from FOSO and without counsel. State appears by Charles Simono. Hawks does not have complaint. State provides complaint to court officer for delivery to defendant. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Hawks understands charges/penalties and wants an attorney, cannot afford his own attorney. Court informs to talk to SPD, continues bond, set for AIA on 3/12/14 at 9:00 AM, sent court appointed paperwork. Hawks asks for lower cash bond or signature bond. State would consider it after counsel is obtained. Court agrees, continues bond.
cash
